Metadata.title: Canopy Charts - Beautiful Data Visualization Library
Metadata.description: A fully customizable, low-level visualization library powered by D3 and styled with Tailwind.

hero.title: Canopy Charts
hero.description: Beautiful and customizable D3.js visuals for React. Accessible. Lightweight. Copy, paste, customize.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.welcome: Welcome to Canopy Charts documentation. This guide will help you get started with our powerful charting library that combines the flexibility of D3.js with the modern features of React.

ownership.title: Your Code, Your Control
ownership.description: Copy and paste what you need, then customize freely without dependency constraints.

modern.title: Modern Stack
modern.description: Built with React + D3.js + Tailwind CSS for beautiful, responsive visualizations.

flexible.title: Flexible Design
flexible.description: Start with sensible defaults, then customize the implementation and design separately.

responsive.title: Responsive by Default
responsive.description: Charts automatically adapt to any screen size with smooth animations.

typescript.title: TypeScript Ready
typescript.description: Full TypeScript support with well-documented props and utilities.

philosophy.title: Philosophy
philosophy.description: Canopy Charts is not a traditional component library. Instead of installing a dependency, you copy and paste the components you need. This gives you complete control over your charts.

why.title: Why this approach?
why.description: Traditional chart libraries often couple style with implementation. By providing copy-paste components:

benefits.control: Full control over implementation and design
benefits.dependencies: No version conflicts or dependency management
benefits.learning: Learn and modify the code as you use it
benefits.bundle: Only include what you need, reducing bundle size
benefits.future: Future-proof: your charts won't break from upstream changes
benefits.security: Better security: review code once, no need to trust external package updates

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: Get started with Canopy Charts in your React project.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: Get started with Canopy Charts in your React project.
installation.intro: Get started with Canopy Charts by installing D3.js as your foundation.

install.title: 1. Install D3.js
install.description: Install D3.js using your preferred package manager:

copy.title: 2. Copy Components
copy.description: Copy the components you need from our library:

customize.title: 3. Customize
customize.description: Customize the components to your needs:

lineChart.title: Line Chart
lineChart.description: A versatile line chart perfect for visualizing trends over time, showing continuous data changes, and comparing multiple series of data.

barChart.title: Bar Chart
barChart.description: A powerful bar chart for comparing categorical data, displaying distributions, and highlighting differences between groups.

donutChart.title: Donut Chart
donutChart.description: An elegant donut chart for displaying part-to-whole relationships and proportional data with an emphasis on the total value.

streamChart.title: Stream Chart
streamChart.description: A flowing visualization that shows how multiple categories change over time, ideal for displaying temporal patterns and proportions.

treemapChart.title: Treemap Chart
treemapChart.description: A hierarchical visualization that displays nested data using rectangles, perfect for showing proportional relationships within categories.

stackedBarChart.title: Stacked Bar Chart
stackedBarChart.description: A beautiful and interactive stacked bar chart component for your data visualization needs.
